title: Multiplying with Zeros

vocab.definition: Any number multiplied by zero equals zero
A zero that holds a place value position but doesn't change the digit value
A zero at the end of a number that affects the place value
A zero at the beginning that doesn't change the number's value
Any number multiplied by one equals that same number
The value of a digit based on its position in a number

teachingNotes: Start with concrete examples using manipulatives. Emphasize zero property vs placeholder zeros. Connect to skip counting and patterns. Use real-world contexts like empty groups.

sample.question: What happens when you multiply any number by zero?
What pattern do you see in 4 × 10, 4 × 100, 4 × 1000?

truefalse.question: Any number times zero equals zero.
Zero times any number equals that number.
When multiplying by 10, you add one zero to the end.
Multiplying by 100 adds two zeros to the end.
The zero in 205 × 3 means the answer will be zero.

multiplechoice.question: Which shows the zero property of multiplication?
What happens to 25 when you multiply it by 0?

fillintheblank.question: Any number multiplied by zero equals _____.
To multiply by 10, add _____ zero(s) to the end.

shortanswer.question: Explain why any number times zero equals zero.
How is multiplying by 10 different from multiplying by 0?
What pattern do you notice when multiplying by 10, 100, 1000?
Give a real-world example of multiplying by zero.
How can you use the zero property to solve 156 × 0 quickly?
Why doesn't the zero in 304 make 304 × 2 equal zero?

wordProblems.question: Sarah has 0 bags of marbles. Each bag contains 12 marbles. How many marbles does she have?
A factory produces 0 cars per day for 30 days. How many cars are produced in total?
There are 8 classrooms with 0 students in each. How many students are there total?
A store sells notebooks in packs of 10. If they sell 40 packs, how many notebooks is that?
A baker makes 0 dozen cookies. How many individual cookies is that?
Each box holds 20 crayons. If there are 6 boxes, how many crayons in total?
A parking lot has 5 rows with 0 cars in each row. How many cars are parked?
